newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea's Jan c/a deficit estimated at over $3 bln.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea's Jan c/a deficit estimated at over $3 bln.

text.p: South Korea's current account (c/a) deficit in January was estimated to have exceeded $3 billion, up sharply from $1.72 billion a year ago, the Ministry of Finance and Economy said on Wednesday.
A ministry official said exports for January were hampered by almost a month of wildcat strikes which erupted in protest against the passage of a controversial labour law which allows worker layoffs.
"The labour unrest hit the nation's major industries, including the auto industry," said the official.
The strikes cost the nation about $509 million in lost exports by late January, according to the Trade Ministry figures.
On Sunday, the Bank of Korea said the nation's c/a deficit widened to a record $23.72 billion in 1996, from a $8.95 billion shortfall in 1995.
